intro: Zephyranthes ananuca, commonly known as the pink rain lily, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in the spring and summer, producing clusters of pink or white flowers that are often followed by bright red berries. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Zephyranthes ananuca is also valued for its ability to bloom even after being cut, a trait that makes it a favorite among florists and gardeners.
